DOC.brief_summary: This study determine whether theoretically-driven web-based 3-hour intervention design male college student call RealConsent effective increase prosocial intervening behavior prevent sexual violence perpetration . Sexual violence program population implement decade United States , program web-based incorporate bystander education model never implement test . In study , male college student recruited online , enrol randomly assign RealConsent comparison condition . Prior intervention , investigator ask question intervene sexually coercive behavior theoretical empirical factor relate study outcome . Investigators survey young men post-intervention , 6-months follow-up determine whether young men RealConsent program intervene often engage less sexual violence compare young men comparison condition . The main hypothesis : ( 1 ) college men RealConsent program report instance prosocial intervening ; ( 2 ) college men RealConsent program report less sexual violence woman .
